title: Do alcohol-free ‘only weekend drinking’ habits still damage the liver?
description: Weekend-only drinking, often perceived as responsible, can still significantly harm the liver. Experts emphasize that the amount and speed of alcohol consumption, rather than the number of alcohol-free days, are key factors in liver damage. This pattern can lead to silent, progressive liver disease, especially for those with pre-existing health conditions.

title: Canada offers research lifeline to Indian talent amid US headwinds in higher education drive
description: Canada is expanding academic engagement with India as Indians face headwinds in the US higher education system. Universities Canada will lead 21 Canadian university presidents on a multi-city India mission to explore research collaboration, academic exchange and transnational education. The initiative aligns with renewed bilateral ties, CEPA negotiations, Canada’s $1.7-billion research strategy and upcoming high-level visits, strengthening long-term education, research and industry partnerships across government, academia and innovation ecosystems in both countries over coming years.

title: Budget 2026 metal sector expectations: MMTC-PAMP pushes for duty parity for refiners
description: India's precious metal refiners are urging the government to address duty disparities that disadvantage local operations compared to imported refined bullion. MMTC-PAMP highlights a mismatch in import duties, particularly through the SEPA route, impacting domestic refiners' competitiveness. The industry seeks policy support, including input-related benefits and wider duty differentials, to bolster India's refining capacity and global standing.

The brutal assault reportedly occurred because the child struggled with her numbers. The father initially tried to conceal the crime by claiming she fell.

title: Priyank Kharge writes to Centre to release pending grants for Gram Panchayats
description: The minister said that the central Government has been delaying the release of the grants for the financial year 2025-26, despite the state government’s timely submission of grant transfer certificates and Gram Panchayat Development plans.

No intention to act against Newslaundry journalist, clarifies HC
300 more killed, Telangana dog toll 900 in a month; sarpanch named in FIR
description: Approximately 300 dog carcasses were discovered in a pit in Jagtial district, Telangana, following alleged mass killings. Animal rights activists claim the incident occurred on Thursday, reportedly on the village sarpanch's orders. Police have registered an FIR against the sarpanch and gram panchayat secretary under relevant sections of the BNS and PCA Act.

title: Do good, earn grace
Donna Kelce sparks Travis Kelce retirement rumors, wedding plans on hold
description: Donna Kelce shared a Times Square billboard promoting a new Kelce brothers project tied to their New Heights podcast, drawing attention as Travis Kelce weighs retirement. While remaining quiet about his NFL future, Travis continues expanding his off field ventures. A recent excited comment about the Chiefs’ coaching move has further fueled speculation that he may return next season.

title: T20 WC row: Bangladesh stare at major financial hit; set to lose millions of dollars
description: Bangladesh's cricket board faces a potential crisis as the national team might withdraw from the T20 World Cup over security and national prestige concerns. This decision, linked to BCB president Aminul Islam Bulbul, could cost the country millions in lost revenue and impact future tours. Players, while assured of match fees, miss a crucial global platform.

title: When teams said no: A look at ICC tournaments hit by refusals and withdrawals
description: Teams withdrawing from ICC events due to security and political concerns is a recurring issue. Notable instances include Australia and West Indies in 1996, England and New Zealand in 2003, Zimbabwe in 2009, Australia in 2016, and India's refusal to tour Pakistan in 2025. These decisions have significantly impacted major tournaments.

title: ‘Nammai Kakkum 48’ scheme benefits over 5 lakh people at city hospital
Census 2027 can open old wounds of demographic changes, says former CEC S.Y. Quraishi
Kerala man’s death: Trial by social media
description: A day after a woman posted a video on social media alleging sexual harassment by a man on a bus, he died by suicide. The episode sparked outrage across Kerala and led to heated discussions on the use of social media, the possible consequences of public shaming, and mental health. Mini Muringatheri reports on an episode that has divided society

title: FIR filed against 5 minor girls for allegedly making Hindu friend wear burqa
description: An FIR has been registered in Moradabad against five minor Muslim girls. They are accused of making their 16-year-old Hindu friend wear a burqa. The incident occurred on December 12, 2025. Police are investigating the matter following a complaint. The law carries a severe punishment for religious conversion by force or fraud.

title: Ukraine, Russia hold first direct talks on latest U.S. peace plan
description: The U.S. initially drafted a plan to end the conflict that was heavily criticised in Kyiv and western Europe for being too close to Russia's line, while later proposals were criticised by Moscow for floating the idea of European peacekeepers

title: Blue room, broken wall: Clues from 10-year-old help nab rape accused
description: Abandoned slippers and a broken wall in a forested ridge led police to crack a sexual assault case involving a 10-year-old girl. Investigators identified a red e-rickshaw with a white roof from CCTV footage, ultimately leading to the arrest of the 25-year-old suspect, Durgesh.

title: Poll bodies of 42 nations to work together on key issues
description: The participants also resolved to review their progress periodically and proposed to meet from December 3-5, 2026 at the India International Institute of Democracy and Election Management (IIIDEM)

title: 'Chemical kitchen': South Delhi police uncover major synthetic narcotics lab
description: South district police arrested a Nigerian national, Emmanuel, allegedly a kingpin in a synthetic drug operation. A "chemical kitchen" was discovered in his Devli residence, a factory for manufacturing high-end psychotropic substances like MDMA and heroin. The bust yielded 113 kg of raw materials, indicating local production and potential international cartel links.

title: Suspected Russia 'shadow fleet' tanker bound for French port
description: The tanker is now expected to arrive on Saturday morning at the port of Marseille-Fos in southern France

title: U.S. imposes sanctions on Iran 'shadow fleet' over protest crackdown
description: The Treasury Department took aim at nine vessels and their respective owners or management firms, which U.S. officials said "collectively transported hundreds of millions of dollars' worth of Iranian oil and petroleum products to foreign markets”

title: UN rights council decries ‘unprecedented’ crackdown in Iran, deepens scrutiny
description: With 25 votes in favour, seven opposed and the rest abstaining, it decided to extend and broaden the mandate of independent investigators gathering evidence towards ensuring accountability for rights violations in the country

title: Sri Lanka gets the better of England in the opening ODI
description: England overcame the early loss of Zak Crawley, who made a disappointing return to 50-over format after more than two years when he nicked Asitha Fernando behind wickets after scoring just 6 runs in his comeback game

title: Will rain continue in Delhi-NCR? IMD forecasts dip in minimum temperature
description: New Delhi experienced its highest single-day rainfall in January in three years on Friday, with 13.2 mm recorded. Overcast skies and gusty winds kept temperatures unusually high for the minimum and low for the maximum. While a dip in minimum temperatures is expected, coldwave conditions are unlikely.

Josh Allen injury update: Bills QB faces uncertainty amid possible surgery concerns
description: Buffalo Bills General Manager Brandon Beane has provided an update about Josh Allen's injury. According to him, the star QB may undergo right-foot surgery. Furthermore, the Bills have faced a serious crisis on their offensive line. The star quarterback has injured himself in their last game against the Denver Broncos.

title: Ray Daniels sparks outrage with explosive LeBron–Kobe comparison
description: Music executive Ray Daniels faced widespread backlash with a controversial statement comparing LeBron James and Kobe Bryant, suggesting Bryant had a "daddy" while James did not. This personal remark, made on his podcast, shifted the debate from basketball to respect and boundaries, drawing sharp criticism from fans who deemed it unnecessary and attention-seeking.

title: Reggie Miller says Stephen Curry should call Giannis as Father Time looms
description: Reggie Miller urged Stephen Curry to recruit Giannis Antetokounmpo to the Warriors, citing Milwaukee's struggles and the Warriors' need for star power after Jimmy Butler's injury. Miller believes this blockbuster move could save Curry's prime and reshape the league, combining two of the game's biggest stars for a championship push.

title: Accenture's leader-led AI training: Julie Sweet urges hands-on learning
description: Accenture CEO Julie Sweet stresses that leaders must grasp AI to guide their companies through transformation. She advocates for leader-led training, citing a client whose 300 leaders had to directly use AI tools before progress was made. This hands-on approach, starting with top executives, is crucial for unlocking AI's potential and ensuring widespread adoption across all sectors.

title: Netflix-Warner Bros merger bid: Greg Peters rejects Paramount’s $108bn offer
description: Netflix co-CEO Greg Peters dismissed Paramount Skydance's $108 billion bid for Warner Bros. Discovery as unrealistic, citing its heavy reliance on debt. He contrasted it with Netflix's more stable $82.7 billion all-cash offer, which is gaining traction with shareholders.  The potential merger faces significant Hollywood and regulatory scrutiny.

title: Davos 2026: Musk, Trump reconcile at memorial; policy rift on US solar energy emerges
description: Elon Musk and Donald Trump have reportedly reconciled, attending a memorial together in September 2025.  Despite this apparent truce, Musk recently diverged from Trump's stance on energy at the World Economic Forum, advocating for solar power to meet America's growing electricity demands, a move contrasting with Trump's pro-oil policies.

title: 7 riders, 1 bike, zero sense: VIP Road viral video stuns netizens; cops launch probe to identify youths
description: Seven young men were filmed riding a single motorcycle without helmets on Bhopal's VIP Road, a video that has gone viral. The reckless stunt, captured in broad daylight amidst heavy traffic, has sparked outrage online. Authorities are investigating the incident, reviewing CCTV footage to identify the individuals and the vehicle involved.
